definition: (of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The great family gradually went into decline.
sentences.chinese: 这个大家族逐渐败落了。

sentences.english: Aurra continued to kill Jedi as the Republic began to decay and crumble around her.
sentences.chinese: 当共和国腐朽败落之时，奥拉继续杀害绝地。

sentences.english: Who cares when peach and plum petals are in decay?
sentences.chinese: 有谁关心桃花和李花正在败落？

sentences.english: The old man came down in the world and had to move to a small town.
sentences.chinese: 这个老人家道败落，只好搬到一个小镇上。

sentences.english: I asked the old monk, did some people often come here? Why was the temple so decline as now?
sentences.chinese: 我问老僧，有人常来此地否，寺庙又何以败落如此。

sentences.english: He gloated over the ruin of his rival.
sentences.chinese: 他幸灾乐祸地看着他对手的败落。

definition: to come down in the world (idiom)/to suffer a reversal of fortune
the Zhou family (household, firm etc)/Jow-Ga Kung Fu - Martial Art
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
